solution_line_template: There are {hogs_to_cats_ratio} times as many hogs as cats in King Henry's kingdom, meaning there are {hogs_count}/{hogs_to_cats_ratio}=<<{hogs_count}/{hogs_to_cats_ratio}={cats_count}>>{cats_count} cats
60% of the number of cats in King Henry's kingdom is {percentage_value}*{cats_count}=<<{percentage_value}*{cats_count}={sixty_percent_of_cats}>>{sixty_percent_of_cats} cats
5 less than 60% of the number of cats in King Henry's kingdom is {sixty_percent_of_cats}-{subtraction_value}=<<{sixty_percent_of_cats}-{subtraction_value}={final_result}>>{final_result} cats
